abstract: Former environmental consultant Robert Reynolds receives three-year probation sentence and $10,000 fine for 2014 chemical spill that contaminated drinking water supply for 300,000 people; Reynolds is first of six former Freedom Industries employees to be sentenced in connection to Elk River contamination in West Virginia.
lead_paragraph: A former environmental consultant at a chemical distributor was sentenced to three years’ probation and fined $10,000 Monday for a 2014 chemical spill that fouled the drinking water supply of 300,000 people.

headline.main: West Virginia: Probation Sentence in Chemical Spill
headline.print_headline: West Virginia: Probation Sentence in Chemical Spill

snippet: A former environmental consultant at a chemical distributor was sentenced to three years’ probation and fined $10,000 Monday for a 2014 chemical spill that fouled the drinking water supply of 300,000 people.
